gurmukhi: ੲਿਹ ਬਿਧਿ ਹਤ ਸੈਨਾ ਭੲੀ ਰਾਵਣ ਰਾਮ ਬਿਰੁੱਧ ॥ ਲੰਕ ਬੰਕ ਪ੍ਰਾਪਤ ਭਯੋ ਦਸਸਿਰ ਮਹਾ ਸਕ੍ਰੁੱਧ ॥੪੧੨॥
transliteration: Eh Bidh(i) Hat Sainaa Bhairaavan Raam Biruddh|| Lank Bank Praapat Bhayo Das- Sir Mahaa Sakruddh||412||
translation: In this way, the army opposing Ram was killed and Ravana, sitting in the beautiful citadel of Lanka got highly infuriated.412.

gurmukhi: ਤਬੈ ਮੁੱਕਲੇ ਦੂਤ ਲੰਕੇਸ ਅੱਪੰ ॥ ਮਨੰ ਬਚ ਕਰਮੰ ਸਿਵੰ ਜਾਪ ਜੱਪੰ ॥
transliteration: Tabai Moukkale Doot Lankes Appan|| Manan Bach Karamannd Sivan Jaap Jappan||
translation: Then, remembering the name of Shiva through his mind, speech and action, Ranana, the king of Lanka, sent his messengers to Kumbhkaran.

gurmukhi: ਸਭੈ ਮੰਤ੍ਰ ਹੀਣੰ ਸਮੈ ਅੰਤ ਕਾਲੰ ॥ ਭਜੋ ੲੇਕ ਚਿੱਤੰ ਸੁ ਕਾਲੰ ਕ੍ਰਿਪਾਲੰ ॥੪੧੩॥
transliteration: Sabhai Mantra Heenan Samai Ant Kaalan|| Bhajo Ek Chittan Su Kaalan Kridaalan||413||
translation: All of them were without the strength of mantra and knowing about their impending end, they were remembering the one Beneficent Immanent Lord.413.

gurmukhi: ਰਥੀ ਪਾੲਿਕੰ ਦੰਤ ਪੰਤੀ ਅਨੰਤੰ ॥ ਚਲੇ ਪੱਖਰੇ ਬਾਜ ਰਾਜੰ ਸੁ ਭੰਤੰ ॥
transliteration: Rathipaaekan Dant Pantianantan|| Chale Pakkdare Baaj Raajan Su Bhantan||
translation: The warriors on foot, on horses, on elephants and in chariots, wearing their armours, marched forward;

gurmukhi: ਧਸੇ ਨਾਸਕਾ ਸ੍ਰੋਣ ਮੱਝੰ ਸੁ ਬੀਰੰ ॥ ਬੱਜੇ ਕਾਨ੍ਹਰੇ ਡੰਕ ਡੳੁਰੂ ਨਫੀਰੰ ॥੪੧੪॥
transliteration: Dhase Naasakaa Sron Majjhan Su Hderan|| Bajje Kaadare Dank Dauroo Naphderan||414||
translation: They all penetrated into the nose and of Kumbhkaran and began to play their tabors and other musical instruments.414.

gurmukhi: ਬਜੈ ਲਾਗ ਬਾਦੰ ਨਿਨਾਦੰਤਿ ਵੀਰੰ ॥ ੳੁਠੈ ਗੱਦ ਸੱਦੰ ਨਿਨੱਦੰ ਨਫੀਰੰ ॥
transliteration: Bajai Laag Baadan Ninaadant(i) Vderan|| Outhai Gadd Saddan Ninaddan Naphiran||
translation: The warriors played their musical instruments; which resounded at high pitch.

gurmukhi: ਭੲੇ ਅਾਕੁਲੰ ਬਿਅਾਕਲੰ ਛੋਰਿ ਭਾਗਿਅੰ ॥ ਬਲੀ ਕੁੰਭਕਾਨੰ ਤੳੂ ਨਾਹਿ ਜਾਗਿਅੰ ॥੪੧੫॥
transliteration: Bhae Aakulan Bi Aakulan Chhodh(i) Bhaagian|| Balikounbhkaanan Taoo Naah(i) Jaagian||415||
translation: All of them, like children, fled in a state of perplexity, but even then the mighty Kumbhkaran did not awake.415.

gurmukhi: ਚਲੇ ਛਾਡਿਕੈ ਅਾਸ ਪਾਸੰ ਨਿਰਾਸੰ ॥ ਭੲੇ ਭ੍ਰਾਤ ਕੇ ਜਾਗਬੇ ਤੇ ੳੁਦਾਸੰ ॥
transliteration: Chale Chhaad(i)kau Aas Paasan Niraasan|| Bhae Bhraat Ke Jaaghe Te Udaasan||
translation: Finding themselves helpless in not being able to awaken Kumbhkaran, all of them felt disappointed and started going away and become anxious on becoming unsuccessful in their endeavour;

gurmukhi: ਤਬੈ ਦੇਵਕੰਨਿਅਾ ਕਰਿਯੋ ਗੀਤ ਗਾਨੰ ॥ ੳੁਠਯੋ ਦੇਵ ਦੋਖੀ ਗਦਾ ਲੀਸ ਪਾਨੰ ॥੪੧੬॥
transliteration: Tabai Devkanniaa Kariyo Geet Gadnan|| Outhyo Dev Dokhigadaa Lees Paanan||416||
translation: Then the daughters of gods i.e. Kumbhkaran awoke and took his mace in his hand.416.

gurmukhi: ਕਰੋ ਲੰਕ ਦੇਸੰ ਪ੍ਵੇਸੰਤਿ ਸੂਰੰ ॥ ਬਲੀ ਬੀਸ ਬਾਹੰ ਮਹਾਂ ਸਸਤ੍ਰ ਪੂਰੰ ॥
transliteration: Daro Lank Desan Pravesant(i) Sooran|| Balibees Baahan Mahaan Sastra Pooran||
translation: That mighty warrior entered Lanka, where there was the mighty hero Ravana of twenty arms, bedecked with great weapons.

gurmukhi: ਕਾਰੈ ਲਾਗ ਮੰਤ੍ਰੰ ਕੁਮੰਤ੍ਰੰ ਬਿਚਾਰੰ ॥ ੲਿਤੈ ੳੁਚਰੇ ਬੈਨ ਭ੍ਰਾਤੰ ਲੁਝਾਰੰ ॥੪੧੭॥
transliteration: Kdarai Laag Mantran Koumantran Bichaaran|| Itai Ouchre Bain Bhraatan Lujhaaran||417||
translation: They all held consultation together and talked to one another about the war.417.

gurmukhi: ਜਲੰ ਗਾਗਰੀ ਸਪਤ ਸਾਹੰਸ੍ਰ ਪੂਰੰ ॥ ਮੁਖੰ ਪੁੱਛ ਲਯੋ ਕੁੰਭਕਾਨੰ ਕਰੂਰੰ ॥
transliteration: Jalan Gadgadisapat Saahaaasra Pooran|| Moukhanndpouchchh Lyo Kounbhkaanan Darooran||
translation: Kumbhkaran used seven thousand metallic pitchers of water to cleanse his face;
